p: Hakea sericea (common name silky Hakea, Proteaceae) is a perennial shrub or small tree (up to 4 m) with irregular top and robust and very sharp needle-like leaves. It was introduced in Portugal for ornamental purposes and for the formation of hedges. It prefers disturbed areas such as along the sides of roads. It is resistant to wind and drought. It is native to Southern Australia [ 9]. It is also invasive in Southern Europe, New Zealand and South Africa [ 18].
